books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.description: A novel by F. Scott Fitzgerald set in the Jazz Age, depicting the lavish lifestyle of wealthy New Yorkers during the 1920s.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.description: Harper Lee's classic novel set in the racially charged atmosphere of the American South during the 1930s.
George Orwell's dystopian masterpiece exploring themes of surveillance, propaganda, and totalitarianism.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.description: J.D. Salinger's coming-of-age novel following the disillusioned teenager Holden Caulfield as he wanders through New York City.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.description: Jane Austen's romantic novel exploring the societal norms and class structure of early 19th-century England.

books.title: Moby-Dick
books.description: Herman Melville's epic tale of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest for revenge against the white whale.

books.title: The Hobbit
books.description: J.R.R. Tolkien's fantasy adventure novel following Bilbo Baggins on his unexpected journey to reclaim the Lonely Mountain.

books.title: The Lord of the Rings
books.description: J.R.R. Tolkien's epic fantasy trilogy chronicling the War of the Ring and the quest to destroy the One Ring.

books.title: The Alchemist
books.description: Paulo Coelho's philosophical novel following Santiago, an Andalusian shepherd boy, on his journey to find his personal legend.

books.title: The Odyssey
books.description: Homer's epic poem recounting the adventures of Odysseus as he journeys home from the Trojan War.

books.title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
books.description: Oscar Wilde's novel exploring the themes of vanity, hedonism, and the consequences of moral corruption.

books.title: Brave New World
books.description: Aldous Huxley's dystopian novel set in a futuristic society where social stability is maintained through psychological conditioning.

books.title: Crime and Punishment
books.description: Fyodor Dostoevsky's psychological thriller follows the troubled student Raskolnikov as he grapples with guilt and morality.

books.title: The Brothers Karamazov
books.description: Fyodor Dostoevsky's philosophical novel exploring themes of faith, reason, and free will through the story of the Karamazov family.

books.title: Anna Karenina
books.description: Leo Tolstoy's epic novel follows the tragic story of Anna Karenina, whose affair leads to her downfall.

books.title: War and Peace
books.description: Leo Tolstoy's historical novel set during the Napoleonic Wars, exploring themes of love, war, and destiny.

books.title: The Grapes of Wrath
books.description: John Steinbeck's novel follows the Joad family as they journey from Oklahoma to California during the Great Depression.

books.title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
books.description: Mark Twain's classic novel follows Huck Finn and Jim, an escaped slave, as they journey down the Mississippi River.

books.title: Frankenstein
books.description: Mary Shelley's Gothic novel about a scientist who creates a grotesque creature in an unorthodox scientific experiment.

books.title: Wuthering Heights
books.description: Emily Brontë's novel of passion and revenge follows the doomed love affair between Heathcliff and Catherine Earnshaw.

books.title: Jane Eyre
books.description: Charlotte Brontë's novel follows the experiences of the orphaned Jane Eyre as she grows into adulthood.

books.title: Great Expectations
books.description: Charles Dickens' bildungsroman follows the life of the orphan Pip as he encounters various characters and experiences.

books.title: The Scarlet Letter
books.description: Nathaniel Hawthorne's novel set in 17th-century Puritan Massachusetts explores themes of sin, guilt, and redemption.

books.title: Les Misérables
books.description: Victor Hugo's novel follows the lives and interactions of several characters over a period of 20 years in 19th-century France.

books.title: The Count of Monte Cristo
books.description: Alexandre Dumas' tale of revenge and redemption follows the story of Edmond Dantès, a young sailor falsely imprisoned.

books.title: Don Quixote
books.description: Miguel de Cervantes' classic novel follows the adventures of Alonso Quixano, who becomes a knight-errant known as Don Quixote.

books.title: The Divine Comedy
books.description: Dante Alighieri's epic poem follows the narrator's journey through the afterlife, guided by the Roman poet Virgil.

books.title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
books.description: Gabriel García Márquez's magical realist novel follows the Buendía family through generations in the fictional town of Macondo.
